meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mentally deranged or insane.
meanings.sent1: Her craziness was evident in the way she spoke to imaginary friends.
meanings.sent2: His craziness made it difficult for him to distinguish between reality and fantasy.
meanings.sent3: The craziness of the situation was both concerning and heartbreaking.
meanings.sent4: The craziness of his thoughts led him down a dangerous path.
meanings.sent5: The craziness of the asylum was a chilling reminder of the fragility of the mind.

meanings.sent1: The crowd erupted into craziness when their team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent2: Her craziness for dancing was infectious, inspiring others to join in.
meanings.sent3: His craziness for collecting stamps was a unique hobby that brought him joy.
meanings.sent4: The craziness of her love for animals knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The craziness of his excitement was palpable in the room.

meanings.definition: The state of being wild or out of control.
meanings.sent1: The craziness of the storm caused widespread damage to the town.
meanings.sent2: The craziness of the party lasted well into the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent3: The craziness of the children playing in the park brought smiles to onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The craziness of the situation required immediate action to restore order.
meanings.sent5: The craziness of the situation was like a whirlwind, leaving chaos in its wake.
